nodes.bodyText: This is a bit weird, but geometry fields currently let you go all the way through to calling termQuery before throwing an error, so this preserves the current behaviour.  It might allow us to support match queries against geometry fields via WKT or something similar in the future, so I think we should leave it in for now.

TextSearchInfo.NUMERIC always returns stored as false.  I thought about making this configurable, but the only place in the code that uses this is in highlighting, and numeric fields can't be highlighted, so I think it's OK to be slightly incorrect here.
does it make sense to add this as a comment somewhere?
I added a comment to TextSearchInfo.NUMERIC javadocs
Add javadocs explaining what are the implications of a null return value?
would it make sense to avoid null values and replace them with a TestSearchInfo.NONE that always returns false? I feel like that may make it easier to trace where it's used and it will avoid NPEs :)
